definitions: To construct or make something by fitting parts together.
To form or articulate (words or a statement).
To present or conceive (a question, issue, or idea) in a particular way.
To incriminate (an innocent person) through the use of false evidence.
To put a frame around (a picture or photograph).
examples: They will frame the new house next week.
He struggled to frame his thoughts into coherent sentences.
The lawyer tried to frame the argument in a different light.
The detective believed someone tried to frame him.
She decided to frame the painting herself.
